a0.speaker: Marisa:
a0.dialogue: Man, oh man, this is surely a wonder of nature to behold, no matter how disastrous it is...

a1.speaker: Marisa:
a1.dialogue: But at the same time, my clothing is all wet. Till when will the rain stop?

a2.dialogue: This storm won't stop unless the Narukami successfully consecrates the residents of land to Eternal Euthymia.

a3.speaker: Kaori:
a3.dialogue: The storm is a sign that her powers are at the zenith.

a4.speaker: Kaori:
a4.dialogue: Thus, she has to use this power to achieve her goal of an Eternal Paradise.

a5.speaker: Marisa:
a5.dialogue: The name sounds a bit suspicious to me.

a6.speaker: Marisa:
a6.dialogue: Tell me, is she the one who is a part of our local band, the Prismrivers?

a7.speaker: Kaori:
a7.dialogue: Prismrivers? I haven't heard of that name.

a8.speaker: Kaori:
a8.dialogue: If there's anyone who claimed she is with them, then they know nothing about the Impeccable Mistress of Thunder.

a9.speaker: Marisa:
a9.dialogue: You are such a stupid suspicious one.

a10.speaker: Marisa:
a10.dialogue: Now, get off my lawn as I won't believe your suspicious words.

a11.speaker: Marisa:
a11.dialogue: The person you're describing closely resembles the person the Prismrivers claim to be missing since it began.

a13.speaker: Kaori:
a13.dialogue: The Narukami Ouki has said that she isn't affiliated with any other entertainment troupes other than those of her family!

a14.speaker: Marisa:
a14.dialogue: Oh, so she belongs to a family who runs an entertainment empire?

a15.speaker: Marisa:
a15.dialogue: Betcha that her family are total fools compared to the classy entertainment of good ol' Gensokyo.

a16.speaker: Kaori:
a16.dialogue: Enough! May your woes be many and your days few... for the heinous act of demeaning the greatness of the Ouki!
